page.title: 19BUILDINGS IN LITTLE BADDOW-2
page.content: There is a fine example of Victorian thatching still visable on the barn of Holybreds Farm in Little Baddow.Possibly this may have been the work of Adolphus Enefer or Samuel Purkis,local thatchers of the time. Pargetting,the unique Essex plaster work decoration on outside walls,can be seen on several houses along Holybred Lane and North Hill. Other types of housing in the area fall into 2 broad categories.The first of these include the late 19th century almshouses and the Victorian terraces in the village itself. The second category includes the more recently constructed buildings, many of which have incorporated the older half timbered style to enhance the character of their homes.
